These badminton rackets are made from top-quality materials, ensuring long-lasting durability and excellent performance. The shaft, crafted from tempered steel, provides a great balance, while the flexible nature of the shaft adds to the overall playability. The racquets come with a full cover for added protection, and they are strung right out of the box, saving you the hassle of stringing them yourself. With an isometric head shape and a 5mm beam width, these rackets offer a larger sweet spot, making them ideal for beginners. The grip size is G4 - 8.25 cm, catering to a wide range of young hands. While the majority of reviews praise the Cosco CB-80 for its quality, ease of use, and durability, some customers have noted that the size might be too small for older kids. However, for the intended age group, these badminton rackets are a hit, offering a fun and engaging way to introduce children to the sport. Overall, the Cosco CB-80 Multicolor Strung Badminton Racquet is a solid choice for kids looking to start their badminton journey.

product_opinion_summary: The Li-Ning G-Force 3800 Superlite Blue, Brown Strung Badminton Racket is a highly-regarded choice among advanced players, particularly those seeking a lightweight yet powerful racket for quick, decisive play. The racket's construction, featuring Japanese Ultra-Carbon Graphite, offers strength and rigidity, ensuring minimal frame deformation for more accurate attacks. The racket's unique UHB Shaft, engineered with cutting-edge technology and real player data, enhances the shaft's performance, improving smash performance significantly. The Aero Tec Beam System and Dynamic Optimum Frame design further optimize the racket's mechanical structure, providing a more efficient attack and defense system. Reviewers praise the racket's lightweight feel, powerful smashes, and good control. The head-heavy design, combined with a low drag coefficient and high intensity, contributes to improved hitting velocity and a wider stringing area. The racket's full cover and strung status are additional conveniences for players. However, some users have noted that the grip size may be smaller than expected, and one reviewer experienced a broken racket upon arrival. To address the grip size issue, it's recommended to consider adding an external grip. With an average rating of 4.2, the Li-Ning G-Force 3800 Superlite Badminton Racket is generally well-received by the badminton community, with more positive reviews than negative ones. Overall, this racket is a strong contender for advanced players seeking a lightweight, powerful, and responsive badminton racket.

product_opinion_summary: The MSI Bravo 15 AMD Ryzen 5 Hexa Core laptop is a high-performing gaming device that delivers impressive results, earning an average rating of 4.4 out of 5. This laptop's standout features include its powerful AMD Ryzen 5 5600H processor, 8GB DDR4 RAM, and 512GB SSD, ensuring smooth and speedy performance for both gaming and productivity tasks. The 15.6-inch Full HD display with a 144Hz refresh rate offers vibrant visuals, making it ideal for gaming enthusiasts. Users appreciate the laptop's dedicated cooling solution, which keeps the device cool and quiet during intense gaming or working sessions. The laptop's design, build quality, and full-sized keyboard are also commended for their quality and comfort. However, some users have noted that the battery life could be improved, and the speakers could offer better sound quality. Additionally, there are no extra M.2 SSD or 2.5-inch HDD add-on slots for storage upgrades, so users may need to replace the existing SSD if they wish to expand their storage capacity. Overall, the MSI Bravo 15 AMD Ryzen 5 Hexa Core laptop is a solid choice for those seeking a budget-friendly gaming laptop with good performance and a high-quality display. While there are some minor drawbacks, such as the battery life and speaker quality, the majority of users find the laptop to be an excellent value for money.

product_opinion_summary: The Redmi Note 12 Pro 5G (Stardust Purple, 256 GB) is a well-rounded smartphone that impresses with its stunning design, balanced performance, and impressive camera capabilities. Battery drain very fast & heating issue

Heating issue
Phone started heating within 5 mins of use. Also Battery drains faster. Do not buy this phone.
Battery is not good  also 15w charger. Phone is heating While using. After taking images no zooming clarity.

I have owned this model since it was launched in India.

My biggest concern has been battery life. I have been extremely disappointed with it as I wasn't able to make it last through the day. The system needs a month or more to understand my usage and optimise battery usage. 

I am always (and I mean all the time) on Bluetooth and WiFi as I work from home. I listen to music all the time. The phone last 6 hours on average. This is far better than the battery life I had at the beginning.

I cannot talk about the camera much as I rarely use it. It's serviceable. 

The screen auto brightness setting is very aggressive sometimes. Dims the screen when it needs to be bright.

The fingerprint scanner is better but becomes unresponsive sometimes. Face recognition is pathetic.

Software is solid. I have Android 11 and things have gotten better. 

Would I recommend it to people? Absolutely not for 41k. It's a phone that should be sold for 35k. It becomes a compelling buy at that point.

I would give this phone 3.5 stars out of 5. I have given it a liberal 4 stars here.
product_opinion_summary: The Samsung Galaxy S20 FE (Cloud Lavender, 128 GB) is a versatile smartphone that caters to social media enthusiasts, photography aficionados, and gaming enthusiasts alike. The device boasts a triple-rear camera setup, including a 12 MP Ultra Wide Camera, 12 MP Wide-angle Camera, and 8 MP Telephoto Camera, allowing you to capture stunning landscapes, close-up shots, and selfies with its 32 MP front camera. With an inbuilt storage capacity of 128 GB, you can store a multitude of photos, games, videos, and more. The Samsung Galaxy S20 FE offers a 16.51 cm (6.5 inch) Full HD+ Dynamic AMOLED Display, providing vibrant colors and a smooth viewing experience. Powered by an Exynos Octa Core processor, the phone delivers impressive performance. The device comes with 8 GB RAM and 128 GB ROM, expandable up to 1 TB, ensuring seamless multitasking and ample storage. The phone's 4500 mAh Lithium Ion Battery offers decent battery life, although some users have reported initial battery drain and heating issues. The Super AMOLED display with a 120 Hz refresh rate is a standout feature, offering a smooth and responsive user interface. The IP68 rating adds to the device's durability, making it resistant to water and dust. While the camera quality is generally well-received, some users have noted average performance in low-light conditions. The phone's UI is praised for its abundance of features, but some users have experienced stutter due to the adaptive refresh rate. Overall, the Samsung Galaxy S20 FE receives a 4.0 average rating, with a majority of positive reviews praising its camera, display, and performance. However, some users have expressed concerns about battery life and heating issues. If you're looking for a mid-range phone with top-tier camera and display quality, the Samsung Galaxy S20 FE is worth considering, but be aware of potential battery and heating concerns.

After seeing a lot of reviews i was expecting a sub par camera. But it surprised me. Photos came out to be decent. Not exceptional by any means but ok.
The phone is well built and firm. I chose white but now regret it because I like the black one more.
Performance is exceptional. Ui is snappy and fluid. Miui comes with a ton of customisation and bloatware 😅. I uninstalled most of them, which gave me a premium experience.
I didn't find the display to be as good. I could sometimes make out the individual pixels (only when I'm looking for it) which is odd because I was using a redmi note 8 before and I haven't experienced any such issues with it. 
Battery life is phenomenal. Even with 5g and bgmi I endup having about 40% battery left. (Phone was in balanced mode, refresh rate set to automatic and on 5G network.)
Speakers are okay, nothing commendable there. Maybe i was expecting more because of all the Dolby Atmos branding. 
Overall for an average user who prioritises performance over camera, poco F5 delivers. I'm happy with the purchase with a slight regret that I didn't go for the black one.
